page.title: 14Energy from Featherstone
page.content: Ackton Hall Colliery is situated at Featherstone.In 1877 two shafts were sunk by Geo Bradley who was the chief landowner.In 1888 it was sold to Lord Hasham and it remained with this family until 1927 when it was aquired by the South Kirby,Featherstone and Hemsworth Collieries Ltd.With nationalisation in 1947 it became under the control of the National Coal Board.Until recently 1150 men were employed with an average weekly output of 13000 tonnes.Most of the coal went for household consumption although some was sent to power stations. However on Wednesday 3rd July 1985 the last coal was cut as the pit is closing down.It has become uneconomic because of geological faults and the loss of faces.The men have been transferred to other local pits and now there is just a skeleton team left
